meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel awkward, self-conscious, or ashamed.
meanings.sent1: When I tripped and fell in front of everyone, it embarrasses me.
meanings.sent2: She embarrasses her friend by revealing a secret in public.
meanings.sent3: The dog embarrasses itself by chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The loud stomach growl embarrasses her during the silent exam.
meanings.sent5: His mismatched socks embarrass him at the formal event.

meanings.definition: To involve (someone) in difficulties or complicated circumstances.
meanings.sent1: Getting lost in the maze embarrasses the children.
meanings.sent2: He embarrasses his brother in a prank that goes wrong.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up embarrasses the team, but they laugh it off.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected rain embarrasses the picnic planners.
meanings.sent5: The confusing instructions embarrass the new employee.
